alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 1:50PM CDT until August 02 at 7:36PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: .A thunderstorm complex will develop tonight along the Iowa Missouri border and slowly move southeast through sunrise. Extremely high atmospheric moisture levels combined with strong forcing will produce very heavy rainfall. Although the area is in a drought, rainfall rates of 2-3 inches per hour may exceed the ability of the ground to soak up the rain. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Rainfall rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour are possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Missouri, including the following counties, Clark and Scotland. The area at highest risk is south and west of a Lancaster, Missouri to Willamstown, Missouri line. * WHEN...From 11 PM CDT this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall amounts of 5 or more inches in a short time is possible. A sharp gradient in rainfall amounts across the northeast parts of Scotland and Clark counties is likely. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
